description.narrative:
Diakonia inkom i oktober 2016 med ett projektförslag till ambassaden avseende stöd till programmet Human Rights and Democracy (HRDEM) in Cambodia för perioden 2017-2019. Det föreslagna programmet är en fortsättning på ett motsvarande program som med svenskt stöd genomfördes under 2014-2016, och bygger på de erfarenheter och resultat som uppnåtts under tidigare fas. Insatsen syftar, liksom tidigare, till att stödja framväxten av ett aktivt civilt samhälle som bidrar till att främja och öka det medborgerliga deltagande i demokratiska processer i Kambodja. Diakonia arbetar därmed huvudsakligen med att öka kapaciteten hos rättighetshavarna, men även ansvarsbärarna (myndigheter på lokal och nationell nivå) involveras på olika sätt.
Inom ramen för programmet kommer Diakonia lämna stöd till 13 lokala enskilda organisationer, vilka arbetar inom områdena mänskliga rättigheter, rättshjälp, yttrandefrihet, arbetstagares rättigheter, media, jämställdhet, valprocesser och demokrati. Stödet lämnas huvudsakligen i form av kärnstöd till organisationernas egen verksamhet men även kapacitetsstärkande insatser ingår. Insatsen fokusera på tre huvudområden: demokrati, jämställdhet och mänskliga rättigheter, för vilka följande effektmål satts upp: (1) aktörer som arbetar för demokrati har stärkts i sin samverkan med myndigheter och allmänheten; (2) en positiv trend för att garantera jämställdhet i samhället avseende såväl initiativtagande som deltagande, beslutsfattande och möjligheter; samt (3) ökad respekt för de mänskliga rättigheterna för att möjliggöra en trygg och säker miljö för individens deltagande i demokratiska processer inom familjen, i arbetslivet och i samhället. Budgeten för insatsen uppgår till 44 miljoner kronor för perioden 1 januari 2017 till 31 december 2019.

In October 2016, Diakonia submitted a project proposal to the embassy concerning support to its programme Human Rights and Democracy in Cambodia for the period 2017-2019. The proposed programme is a continuation of a similar programme that was carried out with Swedish support in 2014-2016 and builds on the experiences and results achieved during this previous phase. In line with the programme for 2014-2016, the contribution aims to support the continued growth and consolidation of an active civil society that can contribute to citizens’ participation in democratic processes in Cambodia. Diakonia thus focuses on increasing the capacity of rights holders, but also the duty bearers (authorities at local and national level) are involved in different ways.
Under the programme, Diakonia will provide support to 13 local partner organizations working in the areas of human rights, legal aid, freedom of expression, labor rights, media, gender, elections and democracy. The support will mainly be provided in the form of core support to the organizations' own activities, but support to capacity strengthening is also included. The intervention will focus on three broad areas: democracy, gender equality and human rights. At aggregate level, Diakonia’s expected results are: (1) actors working for democracy have been strengthened in their interaction with authorities and the public; (2) a positive trend in guaranteeing gender equality in society, in initiatives, in participation, in decision-making forums and in distribution of opportunities; and (3) an increased respect for human rights to enable a secure and safe environment for individual participation in democratic processes in family, work and community. The total budget of the intervention amounts to SEK 44 million for the period 1 January 2017 to 31 December 2019.

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative:
These are preliminary results of the HRDEM programme over the period of three years 2017-2019. The assessment of the following example of results is based on the summary results presented in the final report.
1. On democracy area: - Local and national elections in 2017 and 2018 and the aftermath of these events have been challenging time for Diakonia's partners to work and require adaptive approaches continuously. - Increased number of women elected for 2017-2018 elections but female representation at the national level dropped because of the replacement of the seats of the dissolved opposition Cambodia National Rescue Party (CNRP) allocated by only men members. - Increased knowledge and awareness on democracy as result of the local partners' works and contributions.
2. On gender equality area: - Increased knowledge and capacity of partners and target groups in handling gender-based violence (GBV) and human trafficking cases. - Female commune councilors feel more confident in performing their duties given their capacity strengthened. - Women are increasingly appointed to leadership position in the commune level's structure although men remain holding chief position.
3. On human rights area: - Shrinking space for CSOs has continued to be a core human rights issue experienced by the local partners and human rights defenders in carrying out their work with the target groups. The suppression and sometimes opennig-up for CSOs' operations in Cambodia after the opposition party dissolved in 2017 has been observed. - Diakonia´s partners have supported rights holders to have increased their knowledge and awareness of human rights, e.g. in land disputes. - Diakonia's partners provided vulnerable communities with various support, including medical care, psychosocial support and access to legal representation that enabled them to claim their rights with the authorities. - Diakonia's partners advocated to hold duty bearers to account on issues of justice and accountability.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
